module.description: Multi Channel buffered serial port interfaces with audio devices

register.description: Contains the Lower value received on the data bus

bitfield.description: Data receiver register value loaded from the RBR.

register.description: Contains the upper value received on the data bus

bitfield.description: Data receiver register value loaded from the RBR.

register.description: Contains the lower value to be loaded into the data transmit shift register

bitfield.description: Data transmit register value to be loaded into the data transmit shift register.

register.description: contains the upper value to be loaded into the data transmit shift register

bitfield.description: Data transmit register value to be loaded into the data transmit shift register.

register.description: This register contains configuration bits for McBSP desired operation

bitfield.description: Digital Loop Back Mode enable bit.

bitenum.description: Digital loop back disabled
Digital loop back enabled

bitfield.description: Receive Sign-Extension and Justification Mode bit.

bitenum.description: right-justify and zero-fill MSBs in DRR
right-justify and sign-extend MSBs in DRR
left-justify and zero-fill LSBs in DRR
DX enabler is off
DX enabler is on
Receive interrupt generated by RRDY
Receive interrupt generated by EOF
Receive interrupt generated by NEWFS
Receive interrupt generated by SYNCERR
No sync error detected by McBSP
RBR is not in overrun condition
RBR is in overrun condition
Receiver is busy
Receiver is ready
Receiver in reset
Receiver enabled

register.description: This register contains configuration bits for McBSP desired operation

bitenum.description: Free running mode disabled
Free running mode enabled
SOFT mode is disabled
SOFT mode is enabled
Frame Synchronization logic is reset
Frame Synchronization logic is active
Sample rate generator in reset
Sample rate generator out of reset
Transmit interrupt generated by XRDY
Transmit interrupt generated by EOF
Transmit interrupt generated by NEWFS
Transmit interrupt generated by SYNCERR
No sync error detected by McBSP

bitfield.description: Transmit Shift Register (XSR) Empty status bit.

bitenum.description: XSR is empty
XSR is not empty
Transmitter is busy
Transmitter is ready
Transmitter in reset
Transmitter enabled

register.description: Configure various parameters of receive operation

bitenum.description: Receive word length 8bits
Receive word length 12bits
Receive word length 16bits
Receive word length 20bits
Receive word length 24bits
Receive word length 32bits
32-bit reversal disabled
32-bit reversal enabled

register.description: Configure various parameters of receive operation

bitenum.description: Single phase frame selected
Dual phase frame selected
Receive word length 8bits
Receive word length 12bits
Receive word length 16bits
Receive word length 20bits
Receive word length 24bits
Receive word length 32bits
Receiver no companding, data transfer starts with MSB first
Receiver no companding, 8-bit data, transfer starts with LSB first
Receiver compand using u-law for receive data
Receiver compand using A-law for receive data
Receive Frame ignore disabled
Receive Frame ignore enabled
0-bit data delay
1-bit data delay
2-bit data delay

register.description: Configure various parameters of transmit operation

bitenum.description: Transmit word length 8bits
Transmit word length 12bits
Transmit word length 16bits
Transmit word length 20bits
Transmit word length 24bits
Transmit word length 32bits
32-bit reversal disabled
32-bit reversal enabled

register.description: Configure various parameters of transmit operation

bitenum.description: Single phase frame selected
Dual phase frame selected
Transmit word length 8bits
Transmit word length 12bits
Transmit word length 16bits
Transmit word length 20bits
Transmit word length 24bits
Transmit word length 32bits
Transmit no companding, data transfer starts with MSB first
Transmit no companding, 8-bit data, transfer starts with LSB first
Transmit compand using u-law for transmit data
Transmit compand using A-law for transmit data
Transmit Frame ignore disabled
Transmit Frame ignore enabled
0-bit data delay
1-bit data delay
2-bit data delay

register.description: Controls the operation of various features of the sample rate generator
Controls the operation of various features of the sample rate generator

bitenum.description: the sample rate generator clock (CLKG) is free running.
The sample rate generator clock (CLKG) is running

bitfield.description: CLKS polarity clock edge select bit

bitenum.description: rising edge of CLKS generates CLKG and FSG
falling edge of CLKS generates CLKG and FSG.

bitfield.description: Sample rate generator input clock mode select bits

bitenum.description: Sample rate generator clock derived from the CLKS pin depending on SCLKME
Sample rate generator clock derived from CPU clock depending on SCLKME

bitfield.description: Sample-rate generator transmit frame-synchronization mode selection bits

bitenum.description: Transmit frame sync signal (FSX) due to DXR-to-XSR copy
Transmit frame sync signal driven by the sample rate generator frame sync signal, FSG

register.description: Control and Status bits for multichannel operation

bitenum.description: Traditional/32/128 channel operation
512 channel mode with PDMA

bitfield.description: Enhanced receive multichannel selection enable bits

bitenum.description: Maximum 32 channels can be enabled at one time
Maximum 128 channels can be enabled at one time
Block 1-Channel 16 to channel 31
Block 3-Channel 48 to channel 63
Block 5-Channel 80 to channel 95
Block 7-Channel 112 to channel 127
Block 0-Channel 0 to channel 15
Block 2-Channel 32 to channel 47
Block 4-Channel 64 to channel 79
Block 6-Channel 96 to channel 111
Block 0. Channel 0 to channel 15
Block 1. Channel 16 to channel 31
Block 2. Channel 32 to channel 47
Block 3. Channel 48 to channel 63
Block 4. Channel 64 to channel 79
Block 5. Channel 80 to channel 95
Block 6. Channel 96 to channel 111
Block 7. Channel 112 to channel 127
all 128 channels enabled
all channels disabled by default. Required channels are selected by enabling RP(A/B)BLK and RCER(A/B) appropriately

register.description: Control and Status bits for multichannel operation

bitfield.description: Transmit pin mode configuration, this is used to configure the DX pin state while the time slot is disabled

bitenum.description: Driven as 1
Driven as 0
Traditional/32/128 channel operation
512 channel mode with PDMA

bitfield.description: Enhanced transmit multichannel selection enable bits

bitenum.description: Maximum 32 channels can be enabled at one time

register.description: Configures serial port pin as General purpose input or output

bitenum.description: The McBSP is running
The McBSP is idle

bitfield.description: Transmit General Purpose I/O Mode only select bit

bitenum.description: DR,CLKS are not general purpose inputs, DX is not general purpose output and FS(R/X), CLK(R/X) are not general purpose I/Os.
DR,CLKS are general purpose inputs, DX is general purpose output and FS(R/X), CLK(R/X) are general purpose I/Os.

bitfield.description: Receive General Purpose I/O Mode only select bit

bitenum.description: DR,CLKS are not general purpose inputs, DX is not general purpose output and FS(R/X), CLK(R/X) are not general purpose I/Os.
DR,CLKS are general purpose inputs, DX is general purpose output and FS(R/X), CLK(R/X) are general purpose I/Os.
Frame synchronization signal derived from an external source
Frame synchronization is determined by the Sample Rate Generator frame synchronization mode bit FSGM in the SRGR2
Frame synchronization pulses generated by an external device. FSR is an input pin
Frame synchronization generated internally by sample rate generator. FSR is an output pin except when GSYNC=1 in SRGR.
CLKX is an input pin and is driven by an external clock
CLKX is an output pin and is driven by the internal sample-rate generator
CLKR is an input pin and is driven by an external clock / Receive clock (not the CLKR pin) is driven by transmit clock (CLKX).
CLKR is an output pin and is driven by the internal sample-rate generator or CLKR is an output pin and is driven by the transmit clock.

bitfield.description: Enhanced sample clock mode selection bit

bitenum.description: Signal on CLKS or internal clock
Signal on CLKR/CLKX pin
CLKS pin is at logic low
CLKS pin is at logic high
DX pin is at logic low
DX pin is at logic high
DR pin is at logic low
DR pin is at logic high
Frame synchronization pulse FSX is active high
Frame synchronization pulse FSX is active low
Frame synchronization pulse FSR is active high
Frame synchronization pulse FSR is active low
Transmit data sampled on rising edge of CLKX
Transmit data sampled on falling edge of CLKX
Receive data sampled on falling edge of CLKR
Receive data sampled on rising edge of CLKR
